[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-gas-meter/src/traits.rs] [PartialVMResult return type] [Error Recovery] Can PartialVMResult errors be caught and recovered from inappropriately, allowing transactions to continue after gas charging failures? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-gas-meter/src/traits.rs] [VMResult return type] [Error Propagation] Do VMResult errors properly propagate to transaction rejection, or can error handling bugs allow transactions with gas errors to be committed? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-gas-meter/src/traits.rs] [Trait bounds] [Unsafe Implementations] Are trait bounds sufficient to prevent unsafe implementations that violate gas metering assumptions, or can attackers implement custom types that bypass safety? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-gas-meter/src/traits.rs] [AbstractValueSize] [Size Manipulation] Can AbstractValueSize be manipulated to represent negative or nonsensical sizes, causing incorrect gas charges for value operations? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-gas-meter/src/traits.rs] [FeePerGasUnit] [Price Manipulation] Can FeePerGasUnit be set to extreme values (near zero or maximum) to break gas-to-fee conversions through overflow or division errors? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-gas-meter/src/traits.rs] [Fee vs Gas] [Currency Confusion] Can mixing Fee (Octa-denominated) and Gas (gas-unit-denominated) values cause accounting errors where fees are charged as gas or vice versa? (Critical)
